meanings.definition: Relating to or performed with an otoscope.
meanings.sent1: The doctor used an otoscopic tool to examine the patient's ear.
meanings.sent2: The otoscopic examination revealed a buildup of earwax.
meanings.sent3: The otoscopic device looked like a small flashlight for the ear.
meanings.sent4: Her otoscopic skills allowed her to detect even the tiniest ear abnormalities.
meanings.sent5: The otoscopic procedure was quick and painless, providing valuable insights into the ear's health.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the examination of the ear using an otoscope.
meanings.sent1: The otoscopic evaluation showed no signs of infection in the ear.
meanings.sent2: An otoscopic view helped identify the source of the patient's hearing loss.
meanings.sent3: The otoscopic inspection made the patient giggle as it tickled their ear.
meanings.sent4: His otoscopic expertise allowed him to diagnose ear conditions accurately.
meanings.sent5: The otoscopic examination provided a clear picture of the ear's internal structures.
